model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Co-workers A: Hey, guess what? I sang a solo at church this past weekend!

[MEMORY]
User Description: Co-workers A is a diligent worker at a clothing store who enjoys using their detective skills to solve mysteries. They are upset about Ms. Singh leaving the school and have a close relationship with Co-workers B, whom they used to work with at the clothing store. 

Relationship Description: Co-workers A and Co-workers B have a close relationship, as they have shared memories of working together at the clothing store and solving mysteries. Co-workers A even researched Co-workers B's marital status and suggested applying to be a detective.

Event Description: Co-workers A found out about an employee hiding clothes to sell on the side and used their Sherlock Holmes-like skills to uncover the mystery. They want to celebrate their detective work with drinks after work tonight. Co-workers A and Co-workers B used to work at the clothing store, where they always got paid every Friday and were able to pay their bills on time. They both made $300 in one week and have memories of Ms. Singh leaving.
current_dialogue: Co-workers A: Hey, guess what? I sang a solo at church this past weekend!
memory_text:
User Description: Co-workers A is a diligent worker at a clothing store who enjoys using their detective skills to solve mysteries. They are upset about Ms. Singh leaving the school and have a close relationship with Co-workers B, whom they used to work with at the clothing store. 

Relationship Description: Co-workers A and Co-workers B have a close relationship, as they have shared memories of working together at the clothing store and solving mysteries. Co-workers A even researched Co-workers B's marital status and suggested applying to be a detective.

They want to celebrate their detective work with drinks after work tonight. Co-workers A and Co-workers B used to work at the clothing store, where they always got paid every Friday and were able to pay their bills on time. speaker: Unknown
raw_prediction:
Co-workers A: Yeah, I remember that time we uncovered that mystery at the clothing store. It was so exciting using our detective skills to solve the case.

Co-workers B: Definitely! It was like something out of a detective movie. You've always had a knack for uncovering secrets.

Co-workers A: Thanks, it's just a fun hobby of mine. Hey, speaking of mysteries, have you heard anything about Ms. Singh lately?

Co-workers B: Not really. I think she moved to another state, but I'm not sure where. It's a shame she left, she was such a great teacher.

Co-workers A: Yeah, I miss her. Remember how she used to always bring us donuts on Fridays? Good times.

Co-workers B: Absolutely. Those were the days. Hey, let's celebrate our detective work with drinks after work tonight. It'll be like old times at the clothing store.

Co-workers A: Sounds like a plan! I'll meet you there. Thanks for always being my partner in crime, both at work and in solving mysteries.
